statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

article.description: Kennedy Meeks scored 20 points with nine rebounds and Justin Jackson scored 22 points for No. 9 North Carolina on Saturday to lead the Tar Heels to a 90-82 victory over Boston College.
article.headline: No. 9 North Carolina beats Boston College 90-82
article.linkText: No. 9 North Carolina beats Boston College 90-82
article.story: BOSTON -- No. 9 North Carolina managed to get away from the one who got away. The Tar Heels beat Boston College 90-82 on Saturday despite 33 points from Eagles freshman Ky Bowman, who had originally committed to play wide receiver for Carolina before opting for basketball instead. Bowman scored 10 straight points in the first half to erase a 27-17 deficit and helped BC remain within one or two possessions for most of the game. "For a while it was the Ky Bowman show," Carolina coach Roy Williams said. "He was unbelievable." Kennedy Meeks scored 20 points with nine rebounds and Justin Jackson scored 22 points for Carolina, which led by one or two possessions for most of the game. It was the sixth straight win for Carolina (18-3, 6-1 Atlantic Coast Conference) since a league-opening loss to Georgia Tech. And it was an improvement for BC (9-11, 2-5) over its previous game, a 71-54 loss to No. 16 Virginia. "I was so disappointed on Wednesday night, because that's not who we are," BC coach Jim Christian said. "To me, this is who we are." Bowman was the biggest reason why. Williams said he remembered being contacted by football coach Larry Fedora, who was recruiting a wide receiver from Havelock, North Carolina, and wanted to know if Williams would allow him to play basketball, too. "I'm fairly certain that I'm (remembering) the right guy," Williams said. Williams said OK, but didn't give it much thought. "At that point they told me he was going to be a great, great receiver. So I was going to do whatever I needed to do to help us get the youngster," he said. "Tell Larry he needs to do a doggone better job of recruiting." Bowman changed his mind about football and about going to North Carolina as well. Asked on Saturday how close he came to playing both sports, Christian interrupted and said, "Here? Not close at all." BIG PICTURE North Carolina: Carolina struggled to put away a BC team that was blown out by No. 16 Virginia on Wednesday. Tony Bradley Jr., who missed two games with a concussion, scored five points in 11 minutes for Carolina. Boston College: Bowman scored 10 points combined in his previous two games, but has reached double figures for the fifth time in eight conference games -- twice scoring 33. ROCKING THE RED After scoring just seven points against Virginia, Bowman went back to the red hair dye that has made him a favorite among the Conte Forum fans who wore red wigs on Saturday to copy him. He made 13 of 19 shots -- including 7 of 9 from 3-point range, but also had eight turnovers. "The black hair will never be back," Christian said. "Even my son, 7 years old, said don't ever let him go back." POUND THE GLASS The Tar Heels held off BC mainly by getting second-chance points on four straight possessions to push their lead from three points to 76-70 with 3:15 to play. Theo Pinson had two consecutive put-backs before Hicks had one. He was fouled on the second offensive board and made two free throws. The rebounds were even in the first half, 22-22, but the Tar Heels had 21-9 advantage in the second. They also had a 15-5 edge in the second half on second-chance points. "I think that's where we are most dominant right now and that's where we can take advantage," said Meeks, who had two offensive rebounds. POLL IMPLICATIONS With six straight wins, Carolina has erased the damage from its ACC season-opening loss to Georgia Tech. UP NEXT North Carolina: Hosts Virginia Tech on Thursday. Boston College: Visits Miami on Wednesday. --- More AP college basketball: http://collegebasketball.ap.org and http://www.twitter.com/AP-Top25

videos.headline: Block leads to Berry II jumper for UNC
videos.description: Kenny Williams swats one away for North Carolina, which leads to a transition jumper for Joel Berry II.

videos.headline: Hicks converts and-one layup
videos.description: Isaiah Hicks rebounds the Kenny Williams miss and hits the layup while drawing the foul.

videos.headline: Boston College storming back after Bowman's and-one layup
videos.description: Ky Bowman takes it to the hoop for the tough and-one finish to help Boston College keep up with North Carolina in the first half.

videos.headline: Robinson hits another and-one layup for Boston College
videos.description: Jerome Robinson helps Boston College keep pace with North Carolina in the late first half after the and-one lay-in.

videos.headline: Bowman's 3-pointer gives him 21 points in the first half
videos.description: With the first half clock winding down, Ky Bowman drills his fifth 3-pointer of the half, giving him 21 points in the first 20 minutes to bring BC to within one of North Carolina at the break.

videos.headline: Robinson nails and-one layup
videos.description: Jerome Robinson isn't backing down to start the second half, as he converts yet another and-one layup.

videos.headline: UNC's Jackson shows off range
videos.description: Justin Jackson hits from beyond the arc to build on North Carolina's early second half lead.

videos.headline: No stopping Robinson from his rim-rattling dunk
videos.description: Jerome Robinson makes the steal and goes on the one-man fast break, finishing with an emphatic one-handed dunk for Boston College.

videos.headline: Pinson with athletic finish off offensive rebound
videos.description: Theo Pinson tips in Justin Jackson's miss, as North Carolina maintains a narrow lead with the under-four timeout approaching.

videos.headline: BC's Jeffers with impressive dunk off inbounds play
videos.description: A.J. Turner finds Mo Jeffers off the inbounds pass underneath to cut into the Boston College deficit.

videos.headline: Berry's 3-pointer puts game away for UNC
videos.description: Holding on to a six-point lead, Joel Berry II drains the 3-pointer to boost North Carolina's lead with just over a minute to go solidifying the Tar Heels' win over Boston College.
